title: Charity shops: Six things to check before you drop off your old stuff
description: "We don't want your dirty pants" - charity shops are asking people to call before donating, but why?

title: India Covid-19: Fact-checking misleading claims on oxygen treatments
description: Families affected by Covid in India are being misled by dubious online claims about oxygen treatments.

title: Sadiq Khan: 'I never wanted to be a culture war poster boy'
description: Sadiq Khan on the pandemic, recession and his spat with former US President Donald Trump.

title: Walton-on-the-Naze: 'People are almost panic buying beach huts'
description: Beach huts have never been so in demand in an Essex seaside town - what's all the fuss about?

title: Blossoms singer Tom Ogden: The joy of headlining the UK's first post-lockdown gig
description: Stockport band Blossoms will perform for 5,000 people on Sunday, with no masks or social distancing.

title: Coronavirus: The impact on the deaf community
description: Fresh calls for change are being made as the deaf community continues to be disproportionately affected by the pandemic.

title: The man who lives on one of the UK's remotest islands
description: As lockdown restrictions began to ease, a conservationist from NI moved to a remote UK island.

title: Then and now: When silence descended over Victoria Falls
description: Victoria Falls is one of the natural wonders of the world, yet in 2019, it fell silent.

title: Lebanon Easter biscuit woes symbolise crumbling economy
description: With the cost of living spiralling, even maamoul is beyond the reach of many families.

title: Sweden's IVF programme for single women not 'as good as hoped'
description: In 2016, single women in the country were given the same rights as couples to access fertility treatments.

title: The young woman trying to adopt her friend
description: Arina hopes to formally adopt her friend Nina, whom she looked after during the Covid pandemic.

title: Zero waste bus delivers healthy food to Johannesburg
description: Johannesburg's inner city residents have been given access to a zero waste mobile grocery store.

title: Princess Charlotte celebrates her sixth birthday
description: A photo of the fourth in line to the throne, taken by her mother, is released to mark the day.

title: HMS Queen Elizabeth leaves Portsmouth on maiden deployment
description: The £3bn aircraft carrier will lead the UK's Carrier Strike Group on a tour of Asia.

title: India coronavirus: Over-18s vaccination drive hit by shortages
description: States say they don't have enough doses for people aged 18-45, as new coronavirus cases pass 400,000.

title: Covid-19: Scientist urges patience before 17 May lockdown relaxation
description: Government adviser Prof Sir Mark Wolport says there is "good news" but the virus could "reignite".

title: Clubbers' joy at returning to the dance floor in Liverpool
description: DJs and dancers share their experiences of the "big energy" at the first club night since lockdown.

title: Israel crush: Israel mourns as festival crush victims identified
description: Some 32 of those killed in a stampede at a Jewish festival are identified, with funerals to follow.

title: Yangtze storm: Violent winds kill 11 in Nantong, China
description: At least 11 people are dead and scores hurt after a violent storm hit eastern China on Friday evening.

title: Tottenham in no rush to appoint Mourinho's successor
description: Tottenham are in no rush to appoint a successor to Jose Mourinho, who says he will "wait to be back in football" following his sacking.

title: Giant 300-tonne fatberg blocks Birmingham sewer
description: Severn Trent says the mass of oil, grease and "unflushable" items could take until June to clear.

title: Covid: Care home isolation rule axed for low-risk trips in England
description: The rules will be relaxed in England - allowing for day trips without 14 days' quarantine afterwards.

title: Mali: The world's 'most dangerous peacekeeping mission'
description: British troops have joined what is considered the world's most dangerous UN peacekeeping force in Mali.

title: HMS Unicorn goes under the microscope for preservation project
description: A major survey of HMS Unicorn is under way in Dundee as part of a major preservation project.

title: The Papers: 'Holidays from 17 May' and 'care home freedom'
description: Saturday's papers include details of plans to further ease lockdown restrictions in England.
